title: 115_hr1574
content: The "Protecting Dissenting Viewpoints and Voices Act of 2017" is a legislation that aims to provide viewpoint protection in communications. It amends Title I of the Communications Act of 1934 to include provisions for protecting viewpoints. The "Protecting Dissenting Viewpoints and Voices Act of 2017" prohibits the revocation of licenses or other actions based on viewpoints expressed in broadcast content. It also prohibits placing conditions on viewpoints in transaction reviews. This legislation does not affect the Commission's authority to take action for violations of specific laws. The "Protecting Dissenting Viewpoints and Voices Act of 2017" prohibits revocation of licenses based on broadcast content, including violations of specific laws or public interest obligations. The President is prohibited from directing agencies to take action against individuals based on their viewpoints on public issues in broadcast content. The President cannot impose conditions on approvals or decisions related to public importance issues in broadcast content. This does not affect other presidential authorities. The President is prohibited from directing agencies to take action against individuals based on their viewpoints on public issues in broadcast content. This does not affect the President's authority to direct agencies to take action on violations of specific sections of the United States Code. The term "agency" is defined in this subsection as per section 551 of title 5, United States Code.
